wednus.js File Reference

Detailed Description

This opens the root namespace for Wednus platform, 'W'.

In this file, we:

  • open 'W', the *root* namespace for the platform
  • define basic module loaders
  • implement system/user module libraries
  • prepare the platform ready

Author:
Sundew H. Shin

Variable Documentation

var W

Wednus platform namespace.

Note:
I considered making it a class and prototyping member methods for the class, but I soon realized that establishing a super object and attaching members as its properties is closer to the 'namespace' concept.

to support browsers with premature DOM, set 'path:' value manually

Definition at line 23 of file wednus.js.

W load

Initial value:

 function(subpath, name, lib){  
  lib = lib?lib:'include';
  
  this.modules = {};
  
  if(!this.modules[lib])
    this.modules[lib] = [];
  
  name = name.split(',');
  if(name.length != 1){
    for(var i = 0; i < name.length; ++i)
        this.load(subpath, name[i], lib);
    return;
  }
  
  if(getIndex(lib, name) != -1){
    return;
  }else this.modules[lib][this.modules[lib].length] = name +'';
  
  this.js(this.path + subpath + '/'+ name +'.js');

  
  function getIndex(lib, name){
    for(var i = 0; i < W.modules[lib].length; ++i)
      if(W.modules[lib][i] == name)
        return i;
    return -1;
  };
}
JS loader interface.

This function loads a JS resource existing under the platform root. It introduces the target module to the platform. It also prevents a module's duplicated loading.

Parameters:
{String} subpath path below W.path
{String} name module name
{String} lib libary category name
See also:
W.include, W.module, W.control
Todo:
need to implement the feature checking finish loading
Todo:
add feature checking the target resource availability

W css

Initial value:

 function(url){
  document.write('<link href="'+ url +'" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">');
  document.close();
}
CSS loader.

This function loads a CSS resource existing under the platform root.

Parameters:
{String} url URL of the CSS resource
